channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: I’m literally a museum piece! https://t.co/zjIECs36iw

“Merril points out that her social expectations were shaped not by 1950s conformity but by 1930s radicalism, thus her rejection of the default belief that the girls’ role is to reassure the boys who run everything.” https://t.co/u5estSpCTG
“Also, she was a significant figure in the Futurians and it may be that dealing with certain male Futurians did not incline her to see men as natural leaders.”
Shas lawmaker says Doron Almog 'unworthy of his new position' after footage surfaces in which he says his daughter read from the Torah 30 years ago. https://t.co/t8UGAAqLig
@Weirdascanbe1 @DBashIdeas @jorosenfeld @shuaros Just want to save the next person a Google search. Never heard of the book before.
@Weirdascanbe1 @DBashIdeas @jorosenfeld @shuaros The Empty Wagon: Zionism's journey from identity crisis to identity theft https://t.co/rJQemymirX
@GenizaLab Why don’t you display liturgical poetry? And why would the good doctor be practicing his signature on the margins?
@fmc_dylan Makes me glad to have forwarded your Part II to my audiophile friend.

@datadivajf Comics are totally delightful.
@datadivajf Even though their portrayal of NJ yeshiva high school dismissal hours are not fully accurate. https://t.co/Nfxzl2ZsIK
@ProjectTzimtzum @BenYehudaPress Happy birthday!

Nothing says “We are the world. This is our home planet!” like “New York/New Jersey a Host City” https://t.co/BBx3ULZGWF
And I thought American baseball’s “World Series” was geographically illiterate.
@DandiaAsad Nothing says “We are the world. This is our home planet!” like “New York/New Jersey a Host City”
@AriCohn @BlueBoxDave In the Alito Court, everything settled is new again.
@DandiaAsad @TheRaDR @RabbiJeremy How do those read to native speakers? As kindergarten exercises? As i.n.i.t.i.a.l.s?
Certainly problematic as a government official with a corrupt administration, but props for prioritizing his book tour commitments to his publisher. https://t.co/XcWkRk1yA4

Important thread highlighting “the complete absence -- at least in the text -- of any evidence of a countermobilization against the right-wing parents groups.” https://t.co/WcxlGjvpx0
Note the work the ADL did to push back against the Birchers in the 60s. And note the very well funded efforts to keep the Jewish community from taking a stance against the neo-Birchers.
Meanwhile, one of America’s “top rabbis” just took a cushy dark money post-retirement gig devoted to both-siding racial justice issues. https://t.co/pdVy80jdng
@ZachWeiner We’ll try to stay serene and phat when Alabama gets ASAT.
@fmc_dylan It’s easy to see this as a favor to T-Bone, but… Bob’s father sold record players. Records with super sounds thanks to 21st century super science is totally up Bob’s alley.
@cstross Really wonder what it would have done for your profession if Pournelle, Heinlein, and PKD were on here.

Question for SFF fans: Do the Heinlein bios or any other sources explain *why* the first draft of Number of the Beast was sent back for rewrites?
(Having read the first divergent section of The Pursuit of the Pankera I have my guesses, but I’m looking for documentation.)
@ZacharyBraiterm @BenLorber8 Just going to add that this seems to have crossed over into real life bloody antisemitic violence here in Teaneck. https://t.co/JeRPmpfFkT
@typolad Really? But isn’t Crystal Meth goyish? You just can’t tell with names anymore!

@fmc_dylan Roughly 10ish it looks like — I don’t know the Rolling Thunder release well enough to accurately count. I think only one other studio recording (Whitmark Demos) but again not my area of expertise. https://t.co/t3laKd1H0y
@dzkalman https://t.co/CVOJXbgVBy
@lymanstoneky Say more?
